title: cmd/vet/whitelist: part of Go standard library API?
body:
cmd/vet/whitelist isn't mentioned in any api/go*.txt files, but http://play.golang.org/p/w_9HmN1oJP builds and runs okay.

Was it intentional that this package is exposed to end users, rather than being named cmd/vet/internal/whitelist like other cmd packages?  If so, shouldn't it be included in "go list std" and the api files?

Currently cmd/vet/whitelist is listed in "go list cmd", but "go help packages" says "cmd" is for "the Go repository's commands and their *internal* libraries".
